text: Med Maud over Polhavet is a Norwegian documentary film from 1926, directed by Odd Dahl. The film photographer and air force officer Odd Dahl followed «Maud» for two years from 1922 and filmed the crew on board as they travelled through the unknown Arctic. Roald Amundsen had at this point left the ship for his venture to the North Pole. Odd Dahl filmed the scientific work and many critical situation the crew faced alone on the ice. The crew consisted of:Med Maud over Polhavet (1925) Filmbasen.no, accessed 13 August 2012 * Oscar Wisting, Captain * Harald Ulrik Sverdrup,Harald Ulrik Sverdrup (1888-1957) Fram Museum, accessed 13 August 2012 oceanographer * Odd Dahl,Odd Dahl (1898-1994) Fram Museum, accessed 13 August 2012 airman, photographer * Finn Malmgren,Finn Malmgren (1895-1928) Fram Museum, accessed 13 August 2012 meteorologist * Gennady Olonkin,Gennadij Olonkin Fram Museum, accessed 13 August 2012 telegraphist * Søren Syvertsen,Søren Marentius Syvertsen Fram Museum, accessed 13 August 2012 machinist (died 1923) * Karl Hansen,Karl Hansen Fram Museum, accessed 13 August 2012 handyman * Kakot,Kakot Fram Museum, accessed 13 August 2012 handyman from Sibiria The film had its premiere at Victoria teater on 17 Mai 1926, but was previewed the day before with a lecture at the Universitetet i Oslo. == References == == External links == * * Med Maud over Polhavet (1925) Filmbasen, accessed 13 August 2012 * MAUD-EKSPEDISJONEN (1918-1925) Fram Museum, accessed 13 August 2012 Category:Norwegian documentary films Category:1926 films Category:Norwegian silent films Category:Norwegian black-and-white films Category:Norwegian films Category:1926 documentary films
